title: Citizenship Rights and Responsibilities

vocab.definition: A person who belongs to a country or community
Things that people are allowed to do or have
Things that people should do to help their community
Instructions about what people should and should not do
Treating others with kindness and care

teachingNotes: Connect citizenship to classroom and school rules. Discuss student rights and responsibilities in simple terms. Use examples of helping behaviors and following rules as good citizenship.

sample.question: What does it mean to be a good citizen?
Name one way to show respect at school.
What is a responsibility you have at home?
What is a right you have at school?

truefalse.question: Citizens have both rights and responsibilities.
Being respectful is part of good citizenship.
Rules are made to make life harder.
A right at school is to be safe.
Responsibilities are things we should not do.

multiplechoice.question: Which is an example of being responsible?
Which is a right at school?

choices: A person who lives in a community
